wikitext.*:
'''''sír'''''<ref>{{PE|17}}, p. 65</ref> (also rendered '''''sīr'''''<ref>{{VT|49a}}, p. 17</ref>) is a [[Quenya]] word meaning "river". 

The dual form '''''siryat''''' appears in the sentence ''[[imbë|imbe]] siryat'' ("between two rivers"),<ref>{{VT|47a}}, p. 11</ref> yielding an unattested singular form *''sirya'' ("river").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=Quenya-to-English wordlist|dated=25 December 2008|website=Arda|accessed=30 November 2017}}</ref>

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']], [[Quenya]]/[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]] '''''sīre''''' ("river") derives from the [[Sundocarme|root]] [[SIR]] ("flow").<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 385</ref><ref>{{VT|46a}}, p. 13</ref>

==See also==
*[[Sindarin]] ''[[sîr]]'' ("river")
*[[Quenya]] ''[[siril]]'' ("rivulet")
*[[Quenya]] ''[[-duinë]]'' ("large river")
